channel.title: math.CT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Rectangular torsion theories
item.description: arXiv:2504.01057v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper we introduce and study \emph{rectangular torsion theories}, i.e.\ those torsion theories $(\C,\T,\F)$ with $\C$ a pointed category, where the canonical functor $\C\to \T\times\F$ is an equivalence of categories. In particular, we show that these are precisely the internal rectangular bands in the 2-category of pointed categories.
item.dc:creator: Elena Caviglia, Zurab Janelidze, Luca Mesiti

item.title: Andr\'{e}-Quillen Cohomology and $k$-invariants of simplicial categories
item.description: arXiv:2212.01885v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Using the Harpaz-Nuiten-Prasma interpretation of the Dwyer-Kan-Smith cohomology of a simplicial category $\mathcal{X}$, we obtain a cochain complex for the Andr\'{e}-Quillen cohomology groups in which the $k$-invariants for $\mathcal{X}$ take value. Given a map of simplicial categories $\phi:\mathcal{Y}\rightarrow P^{(n-1)} \mathcal{X}$ into a Postnikov section of $\mathcal{X}$, we use a homotopy colimit decomposition of $\mathcal{Y}$ to study the obstruction to lifting $\phi$ to $P^{(n)}\mathcal{X}$. In particular, an explicit description of this obstruction for the boundary of a cube can be used to recover various higher homotopy invariants of $\mathcal{X}$.
item.dc:creator: David Blanc, Nicholas Meadows
